item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket: How to Get Poke Gold without Spending Money
item.description:
As of the time of writing, there are eleven different currencies in Pokemon TCG Pocket . Although they all have their uses, the most valuable of these is undoubtedly Poke Gold, which can be used for both pack pulls and Wonder Picks. Each piece of Poke Gold also has the same effect as two Hourglasses, meaning players will only need half as much gold to make their pulls.

The main way to get more Poke Gold is by spending real-world money, although there's thankfully another way. Free-to-play players can get their hands on a decent amount of Poke Gold just by playing through Pokemon TCG Pocket , although just as one might expect, there's something of a catch when it comes to the amount of Poke Gold that they can earn this way.

How to Get Free Poke Gold in Pokemon TCG Pocket

Pokemon TCG Pocket players can get free Poke Gold just by earning XP and leveling up their account . For each new level that they hit, they'll be rewarded with one or two pieces of Poke Gold, meaning that it's possible to earn at least fifty pieces this way before hitting Pokemon TCG Pocket 's level cap. It's important to note that the higher the player's level gets, the more XP they'll need to level up, and the only way to reliably farm XP right now is by winning PvP battles, which can be a bit of a grind. However, for those looking to get Poke Gold without spending any money, this is the only viable method at the moment.

Poke Gold Alternatives in Pokemon TCG Pocket

The good news is that players don't need Poke Gold to be able to enjoy all of Pokemon TCG Pocket 's features. Save for some cosmetic items that come bundled with Poke Gold purchases, everything that can be bought using Poke Gold can also be bought using one of the game's ten other currencies. Realistically, though, most people are going to be spending their Poke Gold on Wonder Picks and pack pulls, in which case, players could just as easily be using Wonder and Pack Hourglasses instead of Poke Gold . Both of these currencies can be earned by completing missions or purchased from the shop using Shop Tickets. Each time the shop in Pokemon TCG Pocket 's stock refreshes, players will be able to buy 70 of each, which should come in handy for those hoping to pull something good.

item.title: Metro 2033 Redux: How Long To Beat
item.description:
Based on the now cult-classic novel of the same name by Dmitry Glukhovsky, Metro 2033 Redux is the graphically remastered edition of the original Metro 2033 from 2010. These days, the original version is all but obsolete, so Metro 2033 Redux is the ideal entry point into the series for new players. The story follows Artyom as he tries to save the inhabitants of the Moscow Metro and survive in a post-nuclear hellscape filled with danger and mystery.

For anyone looking to enjoy an immersive stealth shooter who doesn't also mind a sprinkle of horror, Metro 2033 Redux is a great game to try out and is arguably one of the defining games of its era. Unlike Metro Exodus and its larger open world, Metro 2033 is a more linear game and has a large focus on story and events rather than player choice. With that said, it does feature multiple endings, and there are several ways to tackle each chapter of the game ,depending on your chosen playstyle.

How Long Does It Take To Complete Metro 2033 Redux?

To complete the main story, a playthrough of Metro 2033 Redux can take around five to seven hours . This will be enough time to complete the main story and not miss out on anything essential. There are no side missions or optional content in the game either — though there are some collectibles for players to look out for if they are trying to achieve a 100% completionist playthrough with all achievements. For players looking to finish the game on Ranger difficulty, or without killing anyone (which is also possible) and earning all possible achievements, a 100% completionist playthrough can take up to nine hours to finish in its entirety .

Despite its age, even the original Metro 2033 still holds up well today and can be played without too much jank or dated visuals. The Redux edition certainly offers improvements in many aspects, though ultimately, the story and objectives remain unchanged. The Metro series is still very much alive today, with the most recent game, Metro Awakening , releasing on VR.

item.title: Warcraft 3: Reforged - The Defense of Strahnbrad Walkthrough
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Head to Strahnbrad
  • Defend Strahnbrad

While there is the prologue campaign that helps set the scene for the rest of the story of Warcraft 3: Reforged , the Human Campaign is the first major part of the story. In this campaign, players are introduced to Arthas Menethil, the Crown Prince of Lordaeron. It's been many years since the Second War, and peace has returned to the Kingdom of Lordearon, but new threats loom on the horizon as the words of the Prophet go unheeded by King Terenas Menethil II.

The first mission of the Human Campaign, The Defense of Strahnbad, teaches you the basics of controlling Arthas and using his powers to support your troops.

Head to Strahnbrad

After the cutscene, you will have just Arthas and a few knights under your command. There is nothing you can do here, so head south along the road. Eventually, the road splits in two.

If you go along the northeast path, you will come across what appears to be a villager with a quest for you. As you get closer, you will be ambushed by bandits. As a paladin, Arthas can heal your forces, so keep an eye on their health and use Holy Light to keep them alive. You don't have to kill these bandits, but it is a good way to get some EXP for Arthas.

In Warcraft 3: Reforged , hero characters like Arthas and Thrall gain EXP from battle. As they level up, they have talents that you can unlock. Upon reaching Level 2, players can choose to unlock either Devotion Aura or Divine Shield for Arthas.

As you progress toward Strahnbrad, you will come across some villagers who will offer a side quest. The farmer, Gerard, needs help getting his ledger back from the bandits. If you want to take care of this side quest first, go southeast toward the direction of the bandit camp.

There are only a handful of bandits at the camp, and they won't be difficult to deal with. Keep an eye on the health of your units and heal whenever one of them starts to get low on health. Pick up the ledger and the mana potion, and then head back to Gerard to give him the ledger. Upon completing this side quest, you are rewarded with a Tome of Strength that permanently increases Arthas's Strength by one.

Defend Strahnbrad

As you arrive at the gates to the village, you will see a villager get killed by a couple of orcs. Take out the orcs and then head into Strahnbrad. As you proceed further into the village, you will find more orcs.

When you get to the other side of the square, you will trigger a cutscene. Head northwest where there is a larger orc on a stolen horse. This unit has much more health and deals a lot more damage. Try to focus on taking out the orcs that accompany him and then focus all your forces on the large orc. Keep your forces alive by using Holy Light and you will have successfully completed the first mission of the Human Campaign once the cutscene is over.

item.title: 8 Best Roguelike Games Designed Around Co-Op
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Cooperative play enhances the roguelike experience, making it more inviting & engaging for groups of friends.
  • Ember Knights offers fast-paced combat, unique abilities, and great co-op potential for fun game nights.
  • Ravenswatch and Gunfire Reborn are challenging yet rewarding co-op roguelike games with unique gameplay elements.

Roguelikes are fun enough on their own and have a lot of replayability, as that's exactly what they are designed for. However, when friendly cooperation is added into the mix, the genre suddenly becomes a lot more inviting — and a lot more interesting.

There's nothing quite like going through the same couple of stages with different builds and characters, and challenging the same bosses in different ways with a few friends to enjoy the ride alongside. Since roguelikes are created to be played again and again, they're a good bet when a group of friends can't find anything new they want to play, often serving as the de-facto online meet-up location to catch up and chat.

8 Ember Knight

Team-Based Action Roguelike

Inspired by classics like Hades and Dead Cells , Ember Knights takes a gander at the roguelike genre with all the charm of a pixel game and all the mechanics one would expect from a well-developed indie game. The game allows up to four player co-op, making it great for game nights and long sessions with friends.

The game features everything a roguelike lover could ever need: fast-paced combat, unique weapons, abilities, and relics, and engaging combat that is accentuated by a fairly simple but charming story.

7 Ravenswatch

The Witch Doctor Vibe

Ravenswatch is a beautiful game that focuses on combat as much as it does on aesthetics. The gloomy game embraces the emo look and runs with it, creating an identity as the cool older cousin with sick tattoos in the co-op roguelike world.

The game can be very punishing and requires players to work together and cover each other's backs in order to win a run. Though the maps can feel a little generic, especially after playing on them dozens of times, the build variety is well-worth the time investment for players to explore.

6 Windblown

Dead Cell Dev's New Project

Coming from the developers behind the indie darling, Dead Cells , Windblown is a co-op roguelike that is more similar to Hades than to its predecessor. The game features an isometric view, more fast-paced movement than seems healthy, and vibrant colors that give it a unique identity.

The co-op aspect of the game is especially well integrated, fully letting players enjoy the experience with a friend. The game is still in early access and lacks a lot of content that players might expect from the successor of Dead Cells , but there is surely more to come as the team develops the game further.

5 Roboquest

Robot FPS Roguelike

The inorganic brother of Gunfire Reborn , Roboquest sucks the player into a first-person shooter experience where they need to go against hordes of enemy robots as a moving hunk of metal themselves. The gun play in this game is quite fun, and the movement mechanics make the downtime between fights relatively enjoyable as well.

The game works well as a single-player experience but is designed to be played alongside a friend, or 'brobot.' Unfortunately, players can only play with one other player. Fortunately, it has public matchmaking, making it much more convenient to find a partner for your sci-fi journey.

4 Crab Champions

Rave Party Near The Ocean

What's more roguelike than a crab with a gun? Four crabs with guns. Crab Champions is a game that isn't afraid of having overpowered builds, and the power creep in the game can be ridiculous at times. However, that's exactly what makes it so fun to play.

Created by a solo dev with a passion for crab-themed games, Crab Champions is a third-person shooter experience with a promise of pushing high-end pcs to their limits in later stages of runs. It has satisfying movement, it has plentiful weapon choices, and it has enough builds to keep a family busy for a couple of weeks.

3 Gunfire Reborn

First Of The First-Person Shooter Roguelikes

Changing the player's perspective from third to first-person might seem like a small matter, but there weren't many roguelikes before Gunfire Reborn that did anything like that. Fusing the genres of roguelike and FPS, this game lets the player experience the havoc they wreak in an entirely new perspective.

The game has plenty of fun builds, characters, and weapons, making it perfect for casual co-op sessions with friends. The unique abilities of each character, their upgrades and skill trees, and the variety of weapon choices keep players coming back for more.

2 Hellcard

Co-Op Card Game With Depth

  • Developer: Thung Trunk
  • Publisher: Skystone Games
  • Release Date: 2024-02-01

Take Dungeons & Dragons , give it some classic roguelike elements, add multiplayer capability, and transform the mechanics to work beautifully as a card game, and Hellcard is born. The game is a great single-player experience, but it truly shines when two or three people make a party to take on the descent to hell together.

The game takes heavy inspiration from Slay The Spire , but it has plenty of things to set itself apart. Hellcard follows the same kind of route as other deckbuilding roguelikes but distinguishes itself from the crowd with its party and multiplayer mechanics.

1 Risk Of Rain 2

Petrichor V Never Saw It Coming

Risk of Rain 2 is the type of game that sucks a player in as soon as they pick it up. From the start of the journey up until you finally manage to beat it, every moment is filled with high-octane action, friendly banter, and a multitude of tasks for the players to enjoy. Risk of Rain 2 is a co-op roguelike with a punch, containing multiple stages that can be repeated as much as the players want, and a single-player mode that works just as well as the co-op.

There's a lot to love about Risk of Rain 2 , from the item and enemy variety to the unique survivors that players can choose for their runs. Perhaps the most important part about Risk of Rain 2 is the inherent randomness, which the game utilizes quite effectively to make each run feel fresh and engaging.

item.title: FIFA 23: Best Defensive Midfielders, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A good defensive midfielder is crucial for FIFA 23 teams for controlling attacks and counters.
  • Rare, expensive DMs like Kimmich and Kante bolster squads best through good trades.
  • Players like Palhinha, Phillips, and Torreira stand out for their defensive prowess and playmaking skills.

A defensive midfielder has become one of the most important roles in modern teams that need fluidity in attack and defense. Players in this role are expected to aid the defense in stopping certain attacks before quickly moving the ball forward to progressive players in the hope of gaining some control and possibly starting a counterattack as well. DMs are pretty popular in FIFA games as well, especially since they help chase down the opposition and ensure that their attacks don't materialize dangerously while also serving as a link between the defense and the rest of the team.

Some of the best DMs that players can use to bolster their squad extensively in FIFA 23 are very rare and expensive. Players need to secure good trades and deals to get these players in Ultimate Team, and these players will aid most people across the many other modes in this game. With a good DM, players can afford to be more aggressive without worrying about a hole appearing in their defense. FIFA 23 's gameplay may be so tried-and-tested that this irritates people to no end, but players who focus more on the mechanical side of things would want to secure a highly-rated DM who fits in perfectly well with their style of play.

Updated November 14, 2024 by Ben Painter: EA Sports FC 25 hasn't been out long, and some fans may not have picked up that latest game yet. Avid FIFA players may want to return to the latest entry in the FIFA name, FIFA 23. A good place to start when deciding what team to play with and what players to use is picking a solid defensive midfielder. CDMs are useful for breaking up play and aiding the defenders in stopping attacks. This update adds five more of the best CDMs in FIFA 23.

28 Joao Palhinha

Rating: 81

  • Club: Fulham
  • Nation: Portugal
  • League: Premier League (England)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 85

After being linked to some of the top clubs in the world, it was Fulham who signed Joao Palhinha in a big statement signing by the West London club. However, he has moved on to Bayern Munich for EA Sports FC 25 .

Although the Portuguese lacks pace, he makes up for it with his strength, height, and fantastic defensive stats. He is undoubtedly one of the best CDMs in FIFA 23 and will not look out of place among the other stars in the Premier League. Palhinha is also a handy dribbler and can pass out from a deeper role, perfect when playing as Fulham or using him in Ultimate Team.

27 Kalvin Phillips

Rating: 81​​​​​​

  • Club: Manchester City
  • Nation: England
  • League: Premier League (England)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 77

Although his move to Manchester City didn't really work out for him, he is currently on loan at Ipswich Town for EA Sports FC 25 . In FIFA 23 , Phillips is one of the best CDMs in the game.

During his time with Leeds United, he was dubbed the Yorkshire Pirlo due to the similarities in his game to the legendary Italian. Phillips operates best as a deep-lying playmaker. He has decent dribbling stats and is capable of roaming around the midfield and protecting the defense. He shines in his physicality, with 86 aggression and 85 stamina, meaning he will never give up on the field.

26 Lucas Torreira

Rating: 81

  • Club: Galatasaray
  • Nation: Uruguay
  • League: Super Lig (Turkey)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 83

Once at Arsenal, it didn't work out for him in North London, so the Urguyan moved on to Turkish giants Galatasaray, where his game has flourished.

He may not be the tallest, standing at only 166 cm, but he makes up for it with his fantastic work rate and his staggering 90 stamina. There aren't any real weaknesses in his game, he is good in all aspects of the park. He holds the ball well thanks to his low center of gravity. When using a Super Lig team on Ultimate Team, there is only one man to use in that CDM role.

25 Thomas Delaney

Rating: 81

  • Club: TSG 1899 Hoffenheim (on loan from Sevilla)
  • Nation: Denmark
  • League: Bundesliga (Germany)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 76

Thomas Delaney is another player who is a bit of an all-rounder in the midfield. He is very good defensively, but can also take the ball forward and play as a more advanced midfielder. The Dane plays for Sevilla, but on FIFA 23 he is on loan at TSG 1899 Hoffenheim in the German Bundesliga.

Where he shines is his aerial ability. With 91 jumping and 83 heading accuracy, he should be the focal point for set pieces and his 77 strength and 85 aggression will help him get stuck in at both ends of the pitch.

24 Robert Andrich

Rating: 81

  • Club: Bayer 04 Leverkusen
  • Nation: Germany
  • League: Bundesliga (Germany)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 83

A rock at the back, standing at 187 cm, he will head and kick anything that comes at him and protect the defense in his coveted CDM role. He is a much more traditional CDM, but that is giving him a little discredit as he can actually play too, with a decent passing range and also not too shabby from a direct freekick.

The big German will be a great option for Bundesliga teams in Ultimate Team, with his physicality being the best weapon in his arsenal. Partnering him with more offensive players, such as Christopher Nkunku or Marco Reus in the midfield will benefit players massively.

23 Denis Zakaria

Rating: 81

  • Club: Chelsea
  • Nation: Switzerland
  • League: Premier League (England)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 79

Although he didn't play much for Chelsea in real life that season, the Swiss midfielder is still an option to use for the West London club in FIFA 23 . AS Monaco has the honor to utilize his abilities for EA Sports FC 24 , albeit with a slight downgrade to his stats.

In this version of the game, Zakaria is a fast and powerful holding midfielder, with 82 Pace and 85 Physical. He is quick enough to track most forwards and has the passing and dribbling stats to contribute to the attack. For most starting Premier League squads on Ultimate Team, Zakaria is the go-to CDM.

22 Zambo Anguissa

Rating: 81

  • Club: Napoli
  • Nation: Cameroon
  • League: Serie A (Italy)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 80

The Cameroonian is a decent, all-around midfielder, but he excels in defense, with his best stats being 86 Stand Tackle, 85 Strength, and 84 Stamina. He is an excellent carrier of the ball and is a perfect link between the defense and attack, capable of playing in a more advanced CM position also.

Anguissa is 6'0", which works for clearing balls in the air, complete with his 76 and 70-heading accuracy. Although not amazing, he can still chip in in that department. For Ultimate Team players, he plays for Napoli in the Serie A, so that is handy for creating links to him for chemistry.

21 Ibrahim Sangare

Rating: 81

  • Club: PSV
  • Nation: Côte d'Ivoire
  • League: Eredivisie (Netherlands)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 77

The biggest pull to using Sangare in FIFA is his height. Standing at 6 foot 3, he is a powerhouse in the midfield, getting his body in the way of any attack. Not the best passer of the ball, he is certainly no deep-lying playmaker, but that is not his job in the game. He wins the ball back and plays it to those who have a better passing range.

In EA Sports FC 24 , gamers can use these skills in the Premier League, as he made the move to newly promoted Nottingham Forest. His strength is a staggering 91, making him one of the strongest in FIFA 23 , and certainly one of the best CDMs in the game .

20 Idrissa Gueye

Rating: 82

  • Club: Everton
  • Nation: Senegal
  • League: Premier League (England)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 76

Everton re-signed Gueye from Paris Saint-Germain ahead of this season, and he was a much-needed addition to their midfield, offering protection to their defense in the CDM position.

He has 87 Stand Tackle, 86 Interceptions, and 85 Stamina. Gueye can run around the park, making interceptions, breaking up attacks, and offering protection, so the attackers can flourish.

19 Ismael Bennacer

Rating: 82

  • Club: AC Milan
  • Nation: Algeria
  • League: Serie A (Italy)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 83

The AC Milan player fits a bit of a different profile to some of the other CDMs previously mentioned, as his best attributes lie in his dribbling. Specifically, 89 Balance, 87 Agility, and 86 Dribbling is where he excels, offering a different edge in the midfield than a big bruiser.

His passing is also pretty good. He can play it long or break into pockets with his dribbling and play the ball into crucial areas. The Algerian is a threat in attack and defense.

18 Aurelien Tchouameni

Rating: 82

  • Club: Real Madrid
  • Nation: France
  • League: La Liga (Spain)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 85

One of the most talented and sought-after players in the world, it's easy to see why Tchouameni managed to bag a spot in the illustrious Real Madrid team. His ceiling is massive, and one can only imagine just how much Tchouameni will develop in an absolutely star-studded squad.

There's a reason why he's one of the best DMs in FIFA , with the entire world recognizing just how amazing this talent really is. Only time will tell just how far Tchouameni will reach if he continues on this path.

17 Konrad Laimer

Rating: 83

  • Club: RB Leipzig
  • Nation: Austria
  • League: Bundesliga (Germany)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 83

RB Leipzig identifies brilliant talent regularly, so it's easy to see why Konrad Laimer makes this list. The performances of this amazing DM have flown under the radar, but it's only a matter of time before a big club comes around to snap this talent up.

At a respectable 83 rating, it's clear that Konrad Laimer would be a great addition to any squad. For a DM, his pace is great and makes him a great link between defense and attack.

16 Fernando Reges Mouta

Rating: 83

  • Club: Sevilla
  • Nation: Brazil
  • League: La Liga (Spain)
  • Other Position(s): CB
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : N/A

Speaking of underrated players, another name that comes to mind is Fernando Reges Mouta. This player is the definition of fine wine, being a strong part of Sevilla's squad despite reaching his mid-30s.

Fernando has played for several elite clubs and is known for his great defensive and physical capabilities, making him a strong part of any squad. FIFA has recognized his strong physicality, which also shows in his stats.

15 Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg

Rating: 83

  • Club: Tottenham Hotspur
  • Nation: Denmark
  • League: Premier League (England)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 80

Tottenham Hotspur has upgraded quite a bit in recent times. With players like Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, it's very much possible for this team to finally get that elusive trophy that has been evading them for the longest time.

Hojbjerg is easily one of the best players on the team, with his physicality and defensive skills being his strongest suit. His passing is also pretty great, letting him link up quick and efficient passes with ease.

14 Thomas Partey

Rating: 84

  • Club: Arsenal
  • Nation: Ghana
  • League: Premier League (England)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 82

Arsenal has been on a roll this season, with many people arguing that they have a solid chance to finally win the league this season after believing in the Mikel Arteta project. A huge reason for this is the strong squad that Arsenal has built up in recent times, with Thomas Partey being a standout in this regard.

Many people wrote off Partey as a failure from the get-go, but he has definitively silenced his critics. He's a beast in FIFA , with his dribbling, defending, physicality, and passing all being 80 or above!

13 Sandro Tonali

Rating: 84

  • Club: AC Milan
  • Nation: Italy
  • League: Serie A (Italy)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 85

One of the most promising young prospects around, Sandro Tonali is shaping up to be someone truly special. This is something that the EA scouts recognized, leading to him receiving such an impressive rating.

His pace, passing, and physical skills make him a force to be reckoned with. The sky's the limit for Sandro Tonali, and fans hope that he'll be able to achieve his full potential and become one of the greatest DMs of all time.

12 Franck Kessie

Rating: 84

  • Club: FC Barcelona
  • Nation: Côte d'Ivoire
  • League: La Liga (Spain)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 82

Despite their financial problems, there's no denying that Barcelona has managed to build a competent squad. Their team is full to the brim with depth and talent, with Frank Kessie being a pretty great DM in the squad.

His defensive and physical skills are impressive, with the rest of his stats being pretty great too. Suffice it to say, any team that needs a good DM will be pretty well-serviced with Kessie's presence in the team.

11 Declan Rice

Rating: 84

  • Club: West Ham United
  • Nation: England
  • League: Premier League (England)
  • Other Position(s): N/A
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 87

Declan Rice has shot up the ranks to become one of the best English DMs of the current era. It's easy to see why West Ham is unwilling to let this amazing player go despite the efforts of many top teams.

There's still a lot of time for Rice to develop as a talented DM. Players in FIFA 23 should keep in mind to not unleash any shots on goal with this player since he isn't a finisher by any means.

10 Sergio Busquets

Rating: 85

  • Club: FC Barcelona
  • Nation: Spain
  • League: La Liga (Spain)
  • Other Position(s): N/A
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 81

He might be getting on in terms of age, but no one came close to Busquets during his peak as a DM. He's one of the biggest reasons why Barcelona managed to remain so dominant for such a long spell in the 2010s.

Even at 34 years old, Busquets is still rated highly by many fans and players. His 85 rating in FIFA 23 is proof of this, although his pace does make him somewhat vulnerable when moving the ball forward.

9 Marcelo Brozovic

Rating: 86

  • Club: Inter
  • Nation: Croatia
  • League: Serie A (Italy)
  • Other Position(s): CM
  • Rating In EA Sports FC 25 : 82

Inter Milan might not be reaching the heights it did under Antonio Conte during their title-winning season, but their players are still in a class of their own. One of the key reasons they won the title in the 2020-21 season was the contributions of Marcelo Brozovic as DM.

Brozovic is great at passing, dribbling, and defending, making him a great player to tackle opponents and move the ball forward on his own. However, players should keep in mind that his pace isn't the best, and poor positioning will lead to players going ahead of them with ease.
